Name: proUrban Advisory, Planning & Management
Location: 5 Claremont St, South Yarra, Victoria 3141, AU
Overview:
proUrban is a specialist urban planning consultancy that provides advisory and management services to property developers and land owners.
 
Drawing from broad-based experience gained across both the private and public sectors, our approach:

- is founded on a deep understanding of urban planning principles and knowledge of local and state government processes;

 - leverages our working relationships and networks within the development industry, local Councils and other regulatory agencies; and
 
- is always pragmatic and commercially focused.
 
We strive to form a deep understanding of our clients'​ objectives and the way they go about their business. This knowledge enables us to create, implement and manage planning strategies that are directly linked to the achievement of these goals.

We provide urban planning advisory and management services across the development industry. Our clients are developers, landowners, builders and investors. Our services include:

- Development site identification, feasibility analysis support, and planning due diligence.
 
- Securing planning permits: application strategy, preparation and management.
 
- Facilitating planning scheme amendments: developing strategic justification, document preparation, stakeholder engagement and process management.
Consultation, negotiation and engagement with local communities and other stakeholders.
 
- Appointment and management of consultancy teams to deliver planning projects.
 
- 'Front-end'​ project management services during the first half of the project life-cycle, from project inception to the commencement of construction

You’ll find Kilargo products in commercial buildings, high-rise complexes, and health and education facilities around Australia and the world. Whether it’s to reduce bushfire risks or gain energy efficiencies, customers choose Kilargo because we have 30 years of industry knowledge, understand building regulations, and are respected experts in the principles of fire, smoke and sound.

We drive industry standards, delivering products that lead the way in design, manufacturing and quality.
And that commitment extends to our clients. We build solid partnerships through understanding, flexibility, seamless service and genuine enthusiasm. With Kilargo, it’s about providing exceptional solutions for great buildings: making it easy for you to meet regulations, protect people and property, and enhance well-being.

Name: Leffler Simes Architects

Overview:
Leffler Simes is well recognised as one of Australia's leading Architectural and Interior Design Practices with offices in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane and more recently a presence in Beijing.

Our long standing relationship with major International Companies demonstrates that our client’s needs on each project have great importance to us and shows our ability to deliver a quality project each time. 

Leffler Simes encompasses all sectors of the architectural sphere; Retail, Commercial, Industrial, Hospitality, Education, Medical, Leisure and Residential.

In 2014 we were proud to register Leffler Architects Beijing Pty. Ltd. in China. Although we have had projects all around the world this is Leffler Simes’ first international presence. We currently have several projects under construction in Liaoning, Northern China with projects recently completed. 

The practice culture is energetic, multi-faceted and varied, enabling Leffler Simes to produce quality design solutions whilst providing a highly professional service. It is our objective to continually evolve and develop as a Design Practice, always striving to create new and interesting solutions ensuring an Architecture that embodies our Client's values and aspirations, as well as our own.

Overview: Since it's beginning in 1981, DFP Planning has grown to be one of the most respected, independent planning practices in NSW with expertise in strategic planning, development assessment, urban design and development, and retail and economic planning.DFP has developed an enviable reputation for solving difficult and complex planning issues and for achieving innovative and practical solutions to meet the expectations of our many clients.With experience on over 10,000 projects, DFP is well placed to meet the challenges of planning and development throughout the Sydney Metropolitan area and right across New South Wales.Our success relies on our professional team with qualifications and skills in town planning, urban design, heritage, social planning, retail and economic assessment, environmental assessment and project management.Our urban development planning services include	Planning Advice and Due Diligence Assessments;	Feasibility Analysis and Highest and Best Use Studies;	Built Form and Yield Studies;	Urban Design and Master Planning;	Statement of Environmental Effects;	Environmental Impact Statements;	Review of Environmental Factors;	Planning Proposals (rezoning applications);	Development Contributions Plans;	Land and Environmental Court Appeals; and	Expert Witness Evidence for NSW.

Name: Gerry Kho Architects
Location: 11 Hulme Court, Myaree, Perth, WA 6154, AU
Overview:
Gerry Kho Architects is a Perth based multi-disciplinary Architecture and interior firm specializing in Environmental Sustainable Design.  We aim to create Adaptive and Resilient architecture and interiors in residential, institutional, retail and commercial sectors.  The studio was first established as a boutique practice that aimed to promote architecture and to educate the public about how good design can improve their lifestyle, and how we can contribute positively to the built fabric around us.  We see architecture as being more than just a building.

We are a progressive local practice with clients and projects in Perth, Regional Western Australia, the eastern states and overseas including Malaysia, Indonesia and South Africa.  The firm and the principal are registered with the Architects Board of Western Australia and The Board of Architects of Queensland.  Current projects in the office include retail design, commercial + residential interiors, mixed used developments, single residences, commercial buildings, institutional buildings and multi-residential apartment complexes.  We also design furniture and other custom products to suit our architecture and interior designs or by special requests as individual designs.  Presently, clients include home owners, franchises, corporations, retailers, charity organisations and small to large scale property developers.

Name: Tract Consultants

Overview:
Tract is a leading planning & design practice uniting the professional disciplines of town planning, landscape architecture & urban design to provide innovative solutions for complex projects.

Our expertise in planning and design addresses land use function, economics, social wellbeing and environmental sustainability with a focus on aesthetic order and expression.

Experience, skill and creativity mark our work, and while our core services are planning, urban design and landscape architecture, we also count those with backgrounds in architecture, horticulture, fine art, ecology and graphic design among our number.

Whatever the project type, scale or locale, we always begin with the site. The conditions and context, quantifiable and qualitative, tangible and social inform the process and the outcome.
Our studio based model is collaborative and iterative, we review and critique our work to evolve a design.

The durability and innovation of our work is demonstrated in four decades of built projects, while we are focusing on the future.

Name: OCULUS
Location: null
Overview: Don Hoover and Bob Earl founded OCULUS in 1993 with a focus on the design of public space and the exploration of public experience. The practice has evolved over the last 20 years with three interconnected studios in Washington DC, Sydney and Melbourne. People are at the core of public experience and at the core of our work. Our focus is on the everyday routine of daily life rather than on spectacle, style and event. We believe that the design of public space is most powerful when the skills and expertise of all disciplines are encouraged to mix freely and openly; when boundaries are blurred and potentials explored.  We believe we have an important role to play in facilitating this exploration. We are interested in the in-between and the undefined.   Our work is an amalgamation of urban design, landscape architecture, and architecture.  Our process is highly varied; it has a strong base in the craft of what we do and exploration through hand drawing, physical modelling, digital modelling and technical documentation. Contact: australia@oculus.info

Name: Giraffe Technology
Location: Sydney, NSW 2000, AU
Overview: Our mission is to bring order to city information and unleash creativity.Solving problems in cities is difficult: they are complex, data is disjointed, expertise is siloed, and mistakes are expensive. Giraffe was developed to overcome this separation of knowledge and bring together the data and experience of many city making experts in one place. The platform allows you to see a digital twin of the city, draw new buildings in their local context, share them with your team and connect the design to an ecosystem of independent third party apps that provide tailored advice based on your design.Over the next few years, Giraffe will work to be the global network that connects experts and complex city problems to reinvent and shape our future cities. It will enable the digitisation and recording of the design and decision-making process, providing greater transparency and understanding for users and increase their ability to make data-driven decisions.

LAVA

LAVA (Laboratory for Visionary Architecture) was founded in 2007. Directors, Chris Bosse, Tobias Wallisser and Alexander Rieck, have designed the city centre plan for the CO²-neutral Masdar City, the Michael Schumacher Tower in Abu Dhabi, Future-Hotel-Prototype in Duisburg and a new university master plan in Saudi Arabia.

LAVA merges future technologies with the patterns of organisation found in nature to build a smarter, friendlier, more socially and environmentally responsible future.

LAVA combines digital workflow, nature’s structural principles and the latest digital fabrication technologies to achieve MORE WITH LESS: more (architecture) with less (material/ energy/time/cost).

Name: EEKOS Architecture & Urban Places

Overview:
EEKOS : Phonetic of the Greek ‘oikos’ meaning home and family. Origin of the words ecology, economy and ecosystem.

EEKOS is an in-house consultancy based in Perth, Western Australia, providing full-service design solutions in architecture, interior design, landscape architecture, placemaking and urban design. We provide speciality design services where our multi-disciplinary team uniquely and holistically meets the specific needs of our clients across a broad range of project scales and budgets.

EEKOS was established in 2010 bringing together professionals in architecture, interior design, landscape architecture and documentation to provide a complete, in-house service for project procurement, design, documentation and project administration. 

Best-practice design standards are incorporated into every project with an understanding that each project provides the opportunity to demonstrate the highest standard of design and personal service.

SMART BEAUTIFUL RESPONSIBLE

Our design is continually interrogated against these three core principles from inception through to delivery in order to benefit the client, the budget and the overall project delivery. At critical points during the design process we ask ourselves whether it is smart, beautiful, and responsible.

WHAT WE DO

_ Single homes and Residential Developments.
_ Mixed-use and commercial developments.
_ Workplace and office fitouts.
_ Retail and hospitality design.
_ Landscape architecture.
_ Urban design.
_ Placemaking.
_ Coordination of full project delivery including design, planning, approvals and construction stages.
_ Project administration.
_ Masterplanning & development design guidelines.
_ Urban activation & revitalisation.
_ Property Development & Feasibility Assessments.
_ Detailed site analysis, research and due diligence.

Name: Cameron Chisholm Nicol Architects Queensland
Location: 6/18 Kilroe Street, Milton, Brisbane, QLD 4064, AU
Overview:
Cameron Chisholm Nicol specialises in residential, multi residential, retail, commercial architecture and interior design projects.

Cameron Chisholm & Nicol was established in Perth in 1884 and has been in continuous operation since that time. In the 1950’s the partners were Ross Chisholm and Gil Nicol, and together they laid the foundation for the architectural modernism of Perth’s skyline. The practice has received numerous awards for its work on the local and national level including the Royal Australian Institute of Architects Gold Medal.

Cameron Chisholm and Nicol has maintained a leadership role in both design and building technology and has been active internationally for over 30 years. Early commissions include the design of the Australian Chancery and Ambassador’s residence in Brasilia and a consultancy to the Urban Development Authority in Malaysia. CCN has designed projects in Italy, Iran, Yemen, India, Sri Lanka, Japan, P.R. China, Hong Kong, Malaysia and Jakarta.

The Brisbane office was established in 1986 by the Managing Director Henry Peel. In Brisbane major commissions which received Royal Australian Institute of Architects awards include Waterfront Place, Naldham House and Robina Town Centre.

Cameron Chisholm Nicol Architects Queensland continues to work in Brisbane, Townsville and the East Coast of Australia.

Name: BOLD Architecture + Interior Design
Location: 69 Sydney Street, Mackay, QLD 4740, AU
Overview:
BOLD Architecture + Interior Design is an emerging architectural practice based in Mackay. BOLD was founded in 2007 by Stewart and Suellen Bagley and have since worked on a large number and diverse range of projects varying in type and scale.

The name BOLD was inspired by Stewart & Suellen's passion to produce distinct and exemplary architecture appropriate to purpose and place. It was also inspired by a quote by the late Architect, Samuel Mockbee who would challenge his graduating students with the phrase '..proceed and be bold'

The practice currently consists of a team of four which draws on over 40 years of combined experience obtained from many regions of Australia, the UK and Ireland. BOLD strive to not only create an end product that 'works' but more importantly create an experiential building that possesses 'soul'.

For a building to 'work' BOLD believes that each project must have efficient planning that facilitates it's use and enhances it. The design should respond to and control it's climatic conditions and possess sound environmentally, sustainable design principles. However, BOLD also believe that the building and buildings that encapsulate us and surround us must do more than just facilitate use. Buildings can evoke feelings, enhance a sense of place, energise a space and heighten or challenge our senses. It is these qualities of a building that give a building 'soul'.

Name: Construct NSW
Location: McKell Building, 2-24 Rawson Place, Haymarket, NSW 2000, AU
Overview: Construct NSW is a reform strategy designed to rebuild consumer confidence in the design and building industry. And, to support economic growth by encouraging buyers back into the market. By raising industry standards, creating transparency and ratings tools, Construct NSW will empower the consumer to make informed decisions about investing in their home safely. Led by the Minister for Better Regulation and Innovation, Kevin Anderson, and the NSW Building Commissioner David Chandler, this three year reform strategy began in 2019 and has already implemented two major pieces of legislation: the RAB Act and the DBP Act. These aim to bring the industry together under a shared goal of creating "trustworthy buildings". These are buildings that do no harm physically, emotionally, financially or environmentally. These are buildings that are  secure investments, homes and places for people to live safely and well in NSW.

Overview: Steering your town planning, liquor licensing or tourism project through concept, development and approval can seem slow and frustrating — but it doesn’t have to be that way.Imagine having an expert in your corner who can help you achieve your goals smoothly and efficiently.Someone who not only understands the process of town planning and governments, but who is acknowledged as leader in project engagement and advocacy.An expert who knows exactly what’s required, who to consult, and how to speak the language of decision-makers every step of the way.An expert who can lead a team with the necessary track record and experience for successful delivery of your initiative.An expert who will think creatively about your project and your priorities, and help you implement a tailored strategy designed to achieve success.RG Strategic can give you all of this — and more.RG Strategic’s Director is Russell Green — a former local government councillor with more than 16 years’ experience in high-level town planning, liquor licensing, tourism, engagement and strategy development roles.A respected leader in the town planning and tourism community, Russell’s council responsibilities included heading up the town planning portfolios for both Noosa and Sunshine Coast councils; driving and developing regional planning schemes and strategies; reform of LTO and RTO operating structures and delivery models and sitting on numerous statewide planning committees and boards.RG Strategic now offers their clients unique strategic town planning insights and expertise, combined with a practical, hands-on approach designed to achieve your goals sooner.Whether you’re seeking review and evaluation of tourism structure and major events economic and social impacts; town planning approval for a project; liquor licensing for your venue; a strategy for your community or your business; or expert advice on the best way to talk to government decision-makers — RG Strategic can help.

Overview: Bickerton Masters is an architectural & interior design practice. For us, design is as much about the social, cultural and spiritual as it is the structural, aesthetic and pragmatic. While we’ve won awards for our design & planning, we’re more concerned with the solutions, benefits, satisfaction and outcomes we create for our clients and their communities.We have established ourselves as market leaders in the Education, Health and Aged Care sectors by incorporating the most recent research - incorporating elements of best practice in the clinical and therapeutic management of ageing (particularly in dementia design), and challenging the traditional concept of the ‘classroom’ and pedagogical practices. In 2019, the Bickerton Masters group expanded through a unity with Hede Architects. An industry leader in education architecture and with a particular expertise in designing for special needs and disability, Hede Architects brings a reputation for producing buildings that focus on the needs of users. Our Key Sectors include:Tertiary Education (Teaching, Laboratories & Communal areas), Education (K-12, Primary & Secondary including boarding facilities), Health (Hospitals, Acute & Sub-Acute, Medical Centres, Superclinics), Aged Care & Residential Accommodation (Dementia, Cerebral Palsy, Disability Care), Interior Design (Commercial, Refurbishment, Education & Residential), Community Facilities (Leisure Centres, Community Centres, Gymnasiums & Churches), Heritage Buildings (Refurbishment & Modification), and Strategic & Master Planning (Education & Health Campuses & Future-proofing).

Name: AMC Architecture
Location: Unit 2, Ground Floor, 8-10 Hobart Place, Canberra City, ACT 2600, AU
Overview: AMC has consolidated its position as one of Canberra's leading architectural practices since its foundation in 2000. Founding Directors Alastair MacCallum and David Cook established the company with the specific aim of better servicing Canberra clients and this remains core to the business. Since 2000 AMC has enjoyed continued success and growth, with a team of 20+ delivering a broad range of projects in the Canberra region and with Commonwealth clients throughout Australia. Nevertheless the fundamental principles on which the company was established remain the same - namely that a balance between innovative design and the commercial imperative, underpinned by skillful management and a practical approach, leads to the successful delivery of high quality architectural projects. This remains the cornerstone of the company's success. Alastair MacCallum is highly skilled at formulating a project brief and interpreting this into a compelling design solution. He has the capacity to communicate design solutions to clients, authorities and other stakeholders alike and a proven track record of guiding development through the authority approvals process. David Cook is highly skilled at project delivery, able to rationalise a design solution to be fit- for-purpose and logical in terms of construction and the delivery methodology. He has a capacity to establish thorough and coordinated construction documentation, understands project programming from inception to completion and is able to play an effective leadership role in the delivery itself. Together, Alastair and David make for a strong and experienced leadership team always cognisant of the commercial imperative. They are ably supported by a highly skilled and motivated team of professionals including co-directors Dean McPherson and Luke Stanton.

Name: Leaf Architecture
Location: 477 Parramatta Rd, Leichhardt, New South Wales 2040, AU
Overview: Leaf Architecture is a boutique architecture practice with a love of design, people, community and the learning environment.Based in the Inner West, we have immersed ourselves in one of Sydney’s creative precincts with a view to establishing ourselves as a design firm with a functional edge.Although the breadth of our work is broad, our specialisation is the learning environment, comprising schools, early learning centres and tertiary facilities. We maintain this specialisation by our continual research into the current and future trends of learning delivery models. This research, coupled with our experience offers unique benefits, such as our understanding of capital works funding, working with operational environments and most importantly, practical applications of pedagogies.We strongly value research into Teaching and Learning as it is one of our cornerstone approaches to our practice. At Leaf Architecture, we believe that all decisions should be based on research and should have a learning strategy embedded at its core, to enable the continual improvement of learning outcomes for the students. Through this strategy, we can then work with you to design the “third teacher” - namely the learning environment.The experience of our director, Daniel Smith, combined with our passion advancing the learning environment provides schools with an interesting design framework, comprising of Process, Challenge and Outcomes.Our design process has been refined over the past fifteen years to maximise engagement and understanding with the goal of lifting learning outcomes. Designing the learning environment is our passion, working with educators to design a space that reflects their pedagogy is our purpose.

Name: Open House Melbourne
Location: Level 1, 10 Parliament Place, East Melbourne, Melbourne, Victoria 3002, AU
Overview: Since 2008, Open House Melbourne has been connecting people with good design and architecture in the city.We invite people to explore outstanding houses, buildings, infrastructure and landscapes that illustrate our rich history, reflect how we live and work, and offer insights into our future city.We do this through our annual free weekend at the end of July and through a series of accessible, informative and entertaining talks, tours, workshops and events throughout the year.The Weekend puts a spotlight on the unique spaces and places that form the foundation of Melbourne, providing an opportunity for you to consider what makes Melbourne unique. The Weekend showcases buildings of significance in a free and accessible format so everyone can experience the value of good design and architecture, and consider what makes a liveable city. Open House Melbourne received the prestigious Melbourne Award for Contribution to Profile by a Community Organisation in 2012 along with professional recognition for our work promoting architecture to the public with a Special Award from the Australian Institute of Architecture in 2012 and the Chapter President's Prize in 2016.Open House Melbourne is the result of an initiative by the Committee for Melbourne, Future Focus Group, and is part of the Open House Worldwide Network, founded by Open House London.

Name: Office of the Victorian Government Architect (OVGA)
Location: Level 2, 20 Spring St, Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU
Overview:
The Office of the Victorian Government Architect (OVGA) is a leader in enhancing the quality of built environments and is an independent voice for Victorian design. 

Located within the Department of Premier and Cabinet, the OVGA provides leadership and strategic advice to government about architecture and urban design and promotes an awareness about how good design can make great living places and urban environments. Victoria has a global reputation for design excellence in the built environment and this is extended and enriched through the government's support of high quality design outcomes.

We believe good design is essential for a sustainable, inclusive, healthy and beautiful environment that is accessible to everyone.

The OVGA provides advice, advocacy and collaborative services to the Victorian community.

ADVICE
The Office of the Victorian Government Architect provides strategic advice to government about architecture and urban design. Where requested by ministers, we provide advice on specific projects or initiatives. We advise state departments, agencies and local government on how to improve design outcomes for capital works programs, individual projects and broader planning initiatives.

ADVOCACY
We promote an awareness of the importance of good design including the process of making great places and sustainable urban environments.


COLLABORATIONS
OVGA fosters partnerships and collaborations among government, professional, academic, industry and community bodies to maximise excellent design outcomes in the built environment.

Name: Mecone - Urban Planning
Location: null
Overview: Mecone is a leading urban planning, policy and development advisory consultancy with offices in Sydney, Western Sydney, Melbourne and Brisbane.Favouring balance between human needs and the natural environment, Mecone provides practical, economically viable and sustainable advice and development services to private sector and government clients. What is Mecone?Mecone is a mythical Greek City. Known as the city where humans came into conflict with the gods resulting in the gods taking fire away from humans – humankind’s most precious natural resource.To us, Mecone represents the need to find balance between human needs and the natural environment. It also represents how humanity benefits from the natural world and how conflicts with the environment can have major impacts. Why Mecone? We are highly experienced in the provision of statutory and strategic planning services, policy advice, urban graphics and mapping in New South Wales and Victoria.  We are leaders in Integrated Land Use and Transport Planning, having worked on some of the largest and highest profile projects in Australia.Mecone is selected as a preferred consultant and is placed on the consultancy panels for a number of government organisations including the Department of Treasury, Transport for NSW, Local Government Procurement, Roads and Maritime Services, Barangaroo Delivery Authority and NSW Health for the provision of planning and development advisory services.We also have strong relationships with private stakeholders, developers, land owners and specialist consultancy firms.We have long-standing and very good relationships with numerous local Councils and excellent established relationships with State planning authorities in NSW and VIC.

Name: Santelli Architects Pty Ltd
Location: 99-101 Francis Street, Suite 13, Northbridge, Western Australia 6003, AU
Overview:
MISSION

We are passionate about creating aesthetic and functional designs based on traditional practical design and fundamental principles, merged with a creative use of both new and old materials.

We work with sustainable principles in harmony with the phyiscal environment and believe architecture can contribute greatly to society.

We acknowledge we are part of a service industry and as innovators we must still provide for the practical needs of our clients (fit for purpose).

We believe our commitment to excellence in design and service is attested to by our 23 years ongoing relationship with the Catholic Education Office of Western Australia spanning over a total of 40 primary and secondary schools including regional work.


COMPANY OVERVIEW

The original company Julius Elischer and Partners Pty Ltd was formed in April 1987.

It's present name was assumed in 1996 when the remaining two partners split and Mr Alis Santelli continued with the business under its present name of Santelli Architects Pty Ltd.

The company consists of two working Directors, Mr Alis A. Santelli RAIA and Mrs Anne S. Santelli, Finance Manager.

Our recently employed graduates, alongside experienced senior staff, ensure we are able to offer cutting edge design and planning solutions whilst retaining the personalized service which we consider to be fundamental to our company's successful move into the future.

Name: YIMBY Qld
Location: 1 Breakfast Creek Rd, Brisbane, Queensland 4006, AU
Overview: YIMBY Qld is part of the growing, global YIMBY network. We say ‘yes in my back yard’ to good development that makes for better living.We want housing to be available to everyone and so our message is simple, we say YES. We want 3 things: more housing, different types of housing, and the businesses and services that support housing and make our cities and regions work. YIMBYs welcome newcomers into our communities. As housing prices and rents escalate, YIMBYs have become a voice for young people asking “What is my future in this City?”. We believe more housing in different forms will improve housing affordability and more local business and services will improve liveability. But YIMBY Qld is not yes to anything and everything. Quality is important.YIMBY Qld wants to inspire good development outcomes that feature one or more of the four YIMBY Qld qualities. As the voice of good development, we aim to bring back the balance to the urban policy debate, so often dominated by the negative NIMBY (not in my back yard) narrative. We are an independent not-for-profit organisation incorporated under the banner of YIMBY Australia.

Name: Urban Affairs
Location: Level 6, 332-342 Oxford Street, Bondi Junction, NSW 2022, AU
Overview:
Urban Affairs, a service of Elton Consulting, is a news bulletin service focused on urban planning and development. It presents the latest news and research on the issues of urban design, development, construction, housing affordability, sustainability of built form, community engagement, transport and infrastructure.

Each news item contains a link to primary documents from politicians, government agencies, peak bodies and research organisations. Urban Affairs does not re-publish newspaper articles – each bulletin item links straight to the primary document or webpage from the source organisation.

The great majority of our content is not reported by the general media. The Urban Affairs bulletin will keep you informed of the latest news and research, and can highlight opportunities as they arise.

The Urban Affairs bulletin is tailored to suit business, government, and other organisations involved in urban planning and development, and the many industries that surround it.

Name: Demaine Partnership Pty Ltd
Location: Level 2, 17 Madden Grove, Richmond, Victoria 3121, AU
Overview:
Demaine Partnership was founded in 1938 by Robert Demaine, FRIBA, MRAIA. 

Our practice provides full architecture, master planning, interior design, programming, building analysis and health planning services for clients in both the public and private sectors across a range of sectors including education, commercial, club, resort, aged care, retirement and residential design.

We are committed to the production of high quality architecture. We interpret this objective in the broadest possible way to encompass far more than aesthetic criteria, also to considering issues of fitness for purpose, sustainability, durability and innovation.

Our philosophy centres on technical and design excellence. Technical priorities include process management from briefing to final handover and beyond. We place particular emphasis on meeting all the budget and schedule objectives of our projects.

Our Directors, together with a team of Architects and Interior Designers, are involved in the supervision and design of each project from the initial stages of planning through construction and post-construction. We believe that good design emerges from accurately meeting our clients requirements. We achieve this through intensive dialogue, which continues throughout the building design and implementation process. 

We add further value to this process through independent research. We look for better solutions, and a number of patent applications for building technologies are testament to this commitment. We also engage in debate in seeking new solutions to both emerging and existing building programs.  

Our design solutions are driven by the specifics of the brief, not a predetermined design style. We seek to create structures that fit with their environment, are functional, carefully crafted and aesthetically pleasing.

Our work has gained recognition through peer review and awards, but more importantly through ongoing, long term relationships with our valued clients.

Overview:
The Site Foreman, headed up by Stephen Moore as Managing Director, launched thirteen years ago and is now a leading group of Sydney's Inner West-based residential architects and construction project managers, that specialise in architectural design, tender and project management.

From its home of Sydney’s Inner West, The Site Foreman services a broad range of clients locally and along the eastern seaboard from the Northern Beaches, through the upper and lower North Shore, the Eastern Suburbs to the Sutherland Shire. Custom new home designs, major renovations, alterations and additions is the core of the business, with a fast developing portfolio of medium density and multi-residential projects. 

The flexibility of the business model and the adaptability of the packages means that, if you have DA approved or Certificated Complying Development (CDC) plans you can engage us and take advantage of our Tender Management Package. Also offered is a complete range of additional services which include; Engineering, Landscape Architecture, Quantity Surveying & Heritage Reporting.

A straightforward and unique step-by-step system is offered which breaks the process of building or renovating into easy to handle stages. Architectural Design is stage 1, Tender Management is stage 2 and Project Management of the build is stage 3. Each stage is packaged up with set inclusions that are necessary to complete that stage. Each package is a fixed price based on the specifics of each project. 

The Site Foreman's team of talented professionals in residential architecture, construction project management, financial management, and client services successfully deliver an average of 100 projects a year to very happy clients.

Name: Elenberg Fraser
Location: null
Overview:
Elenberg Fraser – not your average architecture firm. An integrated design practice operating across the Asia-Pacific region, our buildings prove that good design leads to economic, social and cultural benefits. But what makes us so special?
 
Invention excites us. We address the needs of our clients, building users and the community by identifying the specific needs of each project. We ask the right questions without imposing pre-determined solutions and then we use our 6Ds process to take us to the invention stage. This process has opened people’s eyes to impossible realities. Who knew buildings could be both design-driven and market-driven?
 
The outcome is sensory – architecture that people can feel, not just see. Architecture that makes people think, acknowledging the origins of architecture and its plethora of influences, both ancient and modern.
 
We are conscious of the impact our buildings have on the city, its inhabitants and the environment. This awareness informs our work – we take pride in the end results but consider the effects and requirements of our projects beyond their completion, well into the future. We practice environmental design based on a first principles approach, inspired by the natural environment.
 
Through interrogation, invention and collaboration we produce experiential spaces that demand reaction.
 
Elenberg Fraser. Feel the difference.

Name: NSW Architects Registration Board
Location: Level 2, 156 Gloucester St, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, AU
Overview: The NSW Architects Registration Board administers the Architects Act 2003, the legislation regulating architects in NSW.  The Board's key role is to protect consumers of architectural services by ensuring that architects provide services to the public in a professional and competent manner, disciplining architects who have acted unprofessionally or incompetently, accrediting architectural qualifications for the purpose of registration,  informing the public about the qualifications and competence of individuals or organisations holding themselves out as architects, and promoting a better understanding of architectural issues in the community. The Board is responsible to the Minister for Innovation and Better Regulation, Matt Kean MP.The work of the Board is totally funded by fees paid by architects and architect corporations and firms.

Name: Novum
Location: L3, Building 3, 53 Prospect Road, Gaythorne, Qld 4051, AU
Overview: Novum is passionate about designing innovative environments and solving complex architectural problems that create positive cultural change and improve lives.In early 2017, having worked together for close to a decade, Peter Boyce and Joel Ridings found themselves asking “what’s next?”Peter and Joel's shared mission is to create new ideas that prove useful and to bring joy to clients, helping their communities thrive. It was this passion that led Peter and Joel to found Novum in 2017. Based in Brisbane, Novum has grown to a team of 10+ and continues to partner with community focused clients throughout Queensland and New South Wales.WE'RE GOOD LISTENERSBefore we launch into thinking about buildings, we will focus on getting to know you.We’ll begin by asking a lot of questions with the goal of deeply understanding you and your community.This understanding goes well beyond the project brief, because in order for us to design a solution that is bespoke to you, our aim is to develop a detailed, nuanced and holistic picture of your culture, history, geography and people.Our goal is to understand you so that as we piece together possible design solutions, they are inspired by, and respond to, your individual challenges and unleash exciting new opportunities. We call this approach "quiet architecture."​It’s not just about ideas, though. Our team has decades of experience bringing communities along a journey from concept through to completion. We love handing over beautiful buildings that have been carefully designed to respond specifically to the needs of the communities they serve. "FOR PURPOSE ARCHITECTURE"​Novum is a culture-led company, where we speak openly about our values and how they permeate and enrich all that we do.Our passion is creating incredible environments that support thriving communities. We seek out genuine partnerships with “for purpose” organisations that have a primary mission to improve lives.

Name: Bateman Architects

Overview:
Established by Norm Bateman in 1989, Bateman Architects is one of Western Australia’s leading health architecture practices – being responsible for delivering numerous highly successful health facilities throughout the State, from regional hospitals to metropolitan medical centres, over the past 20 years.

One attribute that distinguishes Bateman Architects from other firms is our strong practice ethos. The practice ethos is what we stand for and determines how we work. It is:

“a core value and responsibility to design, document and deliver the best possible facility to our clients without fear or favour, with integrity, care and diligence - to provide the optimal solution to our clients’ requirements, within their budget, so that they can provide their function from and within the best possible built environment.”  

Because our practice ethos is based on putting the needs of our clients first, at Bateman Architects our service structure is not rigid but tailored to meet the priorities and objectives of each individual client and their unique project. We aim to be adaptive and responsive, and to work collaboratively with our clients and their stakeholders to provide them with the best possible design service and the best possible outcome.

Our architectural expression is characterised by rigour, an honest expression of structure and materials, and a strong awareness of context. Above all, our architecture is efficient, sustainable and contributes to the community.

Name: Slavin Architects
Location: 1c Pearse Street, North Fremantle, WA 6159, AU
Overview: We are a Fremantle based architectural design practice with a commitment to innovation and a decided aversion to pastiche. Our integrated, soft-edge approach encompasses architecture, landscape and interiors, ensuring that in every case, design elements cohere to create a whole far greater than the sum of its parts. Nothing we design exists in a vacuum. We view each structure as a part of the living landscape it inhabits, considering the impact of each on the other. Our award-winning portfolio spans heritage, civil, commercial, education, spiritual and residential design as well as master planning, furniture and interiors.

Name: Sims White Architects
Location: 111 Campbell St, 6, Toowoomba, Queensland 4350, AU
Overview:
We get out of bed because we love the process of architecture; of creating something unique and special with our clients. The fact that in doing this, we HAVE been awarded and DO make a living is a reflection of the good relationships we have with our clients, our skills as a team and the validity of this approach. 

We are in business because we love what we do. We don’t get out of bed in the morning to make huge profits for our shareholders or to win awards and improve our egos at our client’s expense. What drives us is the satisfaction of adding value to both our client’s businesses and their assets by drawing on our experience of what works.  

•	Architecture – functional, wild, practical or all of the above. You get the best of both worlds 
•	Project Management – we get the job done on time every time 
•	Master planning – we think about the future and the next stage which saving you time and money.
•	Feasibility Studies, Concept design, options studies – we help you work out your needs and your goals. 
•	Facilitation of holistic design processes and environmental outcomes – because getting things right is not a coincidence.
•	Environmentally Sustainable Design – at the core of all we do. There is so much legislation that watchful eyes on all steps of compliance and indeed non-compliance is the core of due diligence.  
•	Sympathetic Renovations – because we love old architecture too!  We are respectful and sensitive while being able to design internal elements specifically tailored to your needs and desires.
•	Design for people with a disability – everybody is welcome. Accordance with these regulations has become second nature to us after integrating accessibility into all the public buildings we have designed. 
•	3-D modelling – helping your visualize your spaces or sell your ideas to others
•	Contract Administration – it’s mundane, but crucial in ensuring the potential on paper is realized in the flesh.

Name: LARKI
Location: L2 / 11 York St, Sydney, NSW 2000, AU
Overview: LARKI is about getting relevant site and neighbourhood information quickly and cheaply. LARKI is a web portal for different types of digital site and neighbourhood information for early stage architecture projects. Information provided through LARKI can be used for land surveying, architectural design and statutory planning projects but might also be used for other purposes such as real estate transactions or strategic planning. Information found through LARKI includes: topography, natural features, land use, property boundaries, roads and sidewalks, buildings and other built features. The information can be provided in different types of digital files, such as: 2D CAD, 3D CAD, Building Information Models (BIM) and Points Clouds.

Name: Kennedy Associates Architects
Location: Level 3 / 1 Booth Street, Annandale, nsw 2038, AU
Overview:
Kennedy Associates Architects is an architectural and urban design practice based in Annandale, Sydney specialising in urban design, site planning, and community, residential and environmental architecture.  The practice was formed in 1994 by Steve Kennedy and currently employs 15 people.

Since formation Kennedy Associates have worked on over 500 projects ranging in value from $100,000.00 to $100m. Kennedy Associates’ client base includes government departments, local councils, religious organisations, community organisations, and private developers.  Our current work includes projects in both Australia and Asia.

Kennedy Associates reputation is based on our rigour, thoroughness, and professionalism.  The firm’s philosophy is based on the exploration and understanding of contemporary architectural issues within a modernist language.  

We are a design based firm, which places significant emphasis on our ability to assess and respond to the urban design, environmental, cultural, programmatic and aesthetic issues of each project.

Fundamental to our practice is the emphasis we place on the rigorous examination of the specific programmatic issues underlying each project, and the consequent preparation and critiquing of a range of design options for each project. 

The core word in our office is ‘beauty’.  We see architecture as the pursuit of beauty in the full depth of meaning of the word.  That is, the achievement of buildings, which not only meet their physical and financial requirements but also provide places which influence and enhance the lives of their users and contribute meaningfully to the progression of our cultural development.

Overview:
EIW is structured to provide architectural services in a way that engages, encourages and inspires our clients. A spirit of collaboration enables visionary ideas to be formulated, sustainable design solutions to be proposed and engenders ownership for the end users in all projects. Our values include:

Respect
EIW values respect in all our relationships. This is embraced with clients, authorities, sub-consultants, trade representatives, builders and sub-contractors alike.

Creativity
Creative thinking goes beyond design solutions and encompasses any task carried out within our organisation. EIW encourages staff members to think creatively in all situations.

Perception

EIW staff that are enriched through their work are passionate about the tasks they perform and the architecture they create.

Name: Contreras Earl Architecture

Overview: Contreras Earl Architecture (CEA) is led by Rafael Contreras and Monica Earl.We founded Contreras Earl Architecture to design original, inventive, ground-breaking buildings that contribute to the evolution of architecture and toward a better future for our communities and cities. We create buildings, spaces, masterplans and objects that are biologically informed and digitally engineered. From mid-sized commercial buildings and mixed-use developments to high-end apartments and bespoke objects, it’s not about the scale of your project, but the scale of your ambition.As architects, we are problem solvers and innovators. We challenge old conventions and contribute new ideas. We believe architecture should evolve with technology, and we embrace the latest technology to push the boundaries of architecture. By using advanced software, robotics, materials and construction processes, we are liberated from traditional building practices and forms, and free to explore more creative, avant-garde ideas. Our design process is driven by the careful analysis of contemporary life and the desire to create buildings that coexist with the built and natural environment. We synthesize research and understand patterns in nature to deliver site-specific solutions that are rich, beautiful and functional – like the natural world. The architecture that emerges is innovative and advanced, imbued with warmth, soul and artistry. Sculptural forms and organic lines encourage public engagement and optimise environmental performance. These are not just grand gestures or bold forms, but reflect our design ethos to realise a better world. Freed from tradition and convention, we can contribute to the evolution of architecture, and together we can create a better future for our urban and natural environments.

Buildings incorporate sustainable, locally sourced and recycled materials that blend houses with their site.In 2010 his son Justin joined the firm and together Peter and Justin refine the practice of well-designed, environmentally sustainable houses.The most recent project delivered in 2020 is an environmentally conscious family home. Located on the West side of the ecologically sensitive Pearl Beach Lagoon.The house is a state of the art passive solar house that generates electricity, uses recycled materials and reveals the natural beauty of the environment around it.

Lacoste+Stevenson is a design-based architectural practice established by Thierry Lacoste and David Stevenson in 1997. As a result of an international partnership, the practice takes advantage of local and global influences to produce a distinctive architecture. The directors lead a creative design studio that is highly skilled in design and building technologies and experienced in building delivery. The practice provides innovative architectural, urban design and interior design services that are tailored to the opportunities and constraints of the brief and budget.

Creative solutions are sought for opportunities and challenges in the built environment, motivated by the desire to provide sensitive and stimulating environments that articulate and facilitate all aspects of human endeavor and encounter.

Projects are not produced in a particular style; each project generates its own outcome as a result of client brief, community and stakeholder consultation, site, budget, environmental measures and creative input resulting in a unique piece of architecture each time. Each commission presents an opportunity to explore design ideas that produces urban design and architecture of delight and intellectual rigour for both clients and users. Environment, landscape and building are often viewed as one in seamless integration.

The collaborative practice of Lacoste+Stevenson is strong on innovative design and the ability to deliver projects given the inevitable challenges that arise during master planning, community consultation, urban design, architecture, costing, documentation and construction. The collective skills of like-minded people from many and varying backgrounds and experience strive to create a level of interaction and enquiry that challenges the obvious and drives innovative, stimulating exceptional architectural and urban design solutions.

Name: Glowing Structures
Overview:
Lighting Design - Architectural

GLOWING STRUCTURES is a creative lighting design consultancy studio, offering design services for a wide range of projects and is focused on consistent performance and reliable creative and technical advice, all in keeping with most recent technological advances. 

Lighting has the ability to change our environment and the way we feel within a space. Glowing Structures combines a creative and unique approach to lighting design with a thorough understanding of the energy conservation and technical requirements projects of today demand. We use our skills to bridge the gap between the client, Architect/Designer and the Electrical Engineer to ensure the design imaginings become reality. 

As a lighting consultancy, independent of all manufacturers, our sole focus is on achieving the best possible lighting scheme for our clients – in terms of aesthetics, form, function, flexibility, maintenance and value for money.

Our approach is implemented by our team of lighting designers who come from a multitude of creative backgrounds including Interior Design, graphic design, and product design. We sometimes work directly for the client and often we are appointed by the architect or interior designer. 

Established in 2007, we provide a personalised design service, where the skills of the designers are multi-faceted and complement one another to provide a succinct, concise design for our clients. We limit the size of the design team, where each member is directly involved, creatively contributing to the overall outcome and maximising the potential of the design to exceed the clients expectations.

The team is young & vibrant and has developed a reputation for providing unique lighting  design services with innovation, ability and effectiveness.
We strive to add value, complement the skills of the design team and create a unique lighting installation which provides value for money and a memorable, exciting experience.

Name: Collins and Turner Architects

Overview:
Collins and Turner is a multi-award winning practice based in Sydney that belongs to a new generation of Australian architects. The focus of the practice is the design and delivery of innovative environments for work, living and play.

Prior to establishing the practice in 2002, both Penny Collins and Huw Turner each gained over 15 years experience internationally, leading teams with industry leaders Pritzker Prize winning architects Norman Foster and Richard Rogers. 

Penny Collins and Huw Turner share equal responsibilities for all aspects of the practice’s management and are closely involved with every project in progress in the studio.

Awards:
2013 - Sir John Sulman Medal for Outstanding Public Architecture, NSW
2013 - NSW Sustainability Award
2013- National Sustainability Award
2013 - National Colorbond Steel Award
(Waterloo Youth Family Community Centre, for City of Sydney)
2009 – Aaron Bolot Award for multiple housing 
(Boomerang Beach) 

Projects:
Collins and Turner has completed projects in Australia, the UK and USA. The practice is currently undertaking a range of projects with a common emphasis on innovation in design, technical resolution and sustainability. 

Projects include residences, workspaces and hospitality spaces around Australia.

Current Projects Include:
- R1 Barangaroo South, Restaurant Building
- Residential Garden Tower, Waterloo, NSW
- James Squire Bars and Microbrewery projects across Australia
- Private Residences

Publications:
Collins and Turner has been published widely in books and magazines, including the Phaidon Atlas of Contemporary World Architecture, a publication documenting 1000 significant buildings of the early 21st century, and included in architecture exhibitions in Berlin, Venice, and Istanbul.

The work of the practice will be chronicled in a forthcoming monograph to be published by Australian independent architecture publisher URO media in late 2014.

Architecture | Urban Strategy

CHROFI (Choi Ropiha Fighera) was founded in 2000 following the success of winning an international competition for the re-design of the TKTS booth in Times Square, New York. This project was widely acclaimed for the way in which the design provided public and private benefits while simultaneously strengthening the essential character of Times Square.

The practice sees design as a tool to extract both commercial and public value; function and form; experience and meaning. 

The practice studio in Manly is now home to a team of twenty six professionals headed by directors John Choi, Tai Ropiha and Steven Fighera. We are highly bespoke in our approach often ‘re-framing’ projects to look beyond any given site and brief to bring broader design opportunities and aspirations.

CHROFI has a demonstrated history of experience in residential, public and urban projects.

Our practice is renowned for its ability to generate clear, strong, strategic ideas that maximise both public benefits and private or commercial interest. From feasibility, to final construction we offer an integrated design approach that combines place-making, urban design, architecture and commercial feasibility that meets the aspirations of the community, approval authority and our client. The very best solutions for urban design and place-making of the site at the beginning of the project can be informed by experienced architectural knowledge in commercial reality and good apartment amenity. Our design based approach is an asset in negotiating with authorities and  creating consensus with stakeholders, ultimately expediting the approval process.

Name: TERROIR
Location: null
Overview: TERROIR was established in 1999 by the three founding directors Scott Balmforth, Gerard Reinmuth and Richard Blythe. The ambition of the practice since then has been to provide the best possible architectural outcome forclients within the given resources of the project. TERROIR is currently managed by four Principals, Scott Balmforth in Hobart, Chris Rogers & Tamara Donnellan in Sydney and Gerard Reinmuth in Sydney and Copenhagen.The ambition of the practice since then has been to provide the best possible architectural outcome for clients within the given resources of the project. The central focus of this work is to create unique projects borne of the specific alchemy possible in each situation. Thus, the potential of the project is dependent on how the interests of the client, site, budget and use are fused into a specific solution. The purpose of our work is then to see how these combinations of different interests can be seen not as a limitation but rather an opening up of new opportunities. The result is a folio of buildings that are more than bricks and mortar. We see them as propositions about the state of the world and our place within it.TERROIR was established in response to our perception of a missing link in the architectural profession - a practice specialising in unique solutions for public, commercial and residential projects, small enough to provide dedicated personalised service, but large enough to manage projects of any type or scale. We have found this focus and strategy of significant value in complex projects requiring long term design and management strategies where a long term commitment to a client and project is necessary to achieve its full implementation.

Name: carabiner
Location: 572 Hay St, Perth, Western Australia 6000, AU
Overview: No two buildings are ever the same. Every public building we have created – from sport and art centres to clinics and museums – is designed for its own purpose. And we believe it’s to serve the people who use them every day, each on their own unique path.At the heart of it, we don’t design empty buildings. Our buildings teem with life – messy, exciting, creative, human life.We also think there’s something to be said for an architect with genuine interest and understanding of a building’s purpose, and who designs it accordingly. No grandeur-driven agenda. Just good, thorough design that will last.Just think about all the time you spend in and around buildings. Of course, you’re probably sitting in one right now. You might not immediately notice a great one, but if it’s bad, you’ll know it. Spend enough time there and it’ll start to affect not only what you do, but how you feel. So, for us, designing one poorly is simply not an option. In fact, that goes for most things we do. It’s just not in our nature.And that’s just what we’ve been doing for over 20 years. Designing good public buildings – from hospitals, schools, community and sport centres, to police stations, courthouses, and even airports. All our works are unique, responding to their sites, communities, cultures, and aspirations.We don’t take our responsibility lightly. Public buildings are funded by all of us and will be used by many people. The impact of our design decisions will affect people we have never met before, and for many years to come. We also consider ecological, economic, and social sustainability in every design.And over all else, we’re guides, not gurus. We’re not out to conquer the great peaks of life alone. A little like the Sherpas at Everest, we empower our clients with our expert guidance, in order to create buildings that will help them reach their own great heights. We make extraordinary architecture, together.

Name: Architects Accreditation Council of Australia
Location: Suite 3, Level 5 75 Castlereagh Street, Sydney, NSW 2000, AU
Overview: AACA is the national voice for architect registration boards around Australia and owns the National Standard of Competency for Architects. The National Standard underpins all assessment processes including the accreditation of architecture programs leading to registration as an architect in Australia.Set up as a not-for-profit organisation, we were established in the 1970s in response to the need for a nationally consistent approach to eligibility for registration and the recognition of overseas qualifications in architecture.We are building our capacity as the key source of information about the architecture profession in Australian and how it compares with architectural education and regulation around the world.Each of the Nominating Bodies (architect registration boards) is an independent statutory authority and is responsible for administering the Architects Act in its jurisdiction. The Boards and the AACA work in collaboration on matters of national interest to the profession, industry and the public.

Name: Klopper & Davis Architects

Overview: Klopper & Davis Architects is a boutique architectural design studio. Each project is designed specifically for our clients and is much a collaboration as a design consultancy. Sam Klopper and Matt Davis studied together, found like-minded architects in each other and started the practice based on a collaborative and complementary skills base. Incorporated in 1996 as NQ CAD, SEQ Steel Detailing underwent a company name change in 2013. 

SEQ Steel Detailing are a team of drafters specialising in providing detail drawings for use in the fabrication of structural steel.

We are involved in projects located throughout Australia and overseas. SEQ Steel Detailing is a full service company that has been serving the steel fabrication industry since incorporation and operates from our commercial offices in Fortitude Valley owned by us.

SEQ Steel Detailing produces detail drawings to the format recommended by the Australian Institute of Steel Construction and the relevant Australian Standards. We also have experience in overseas contracts using steel sections and construction standards from the country of origin.

Structural steel workshop fabrication drawings are produced in both 2D and 3D AutoCAD and Prosteel/Prostructures compatible formats. Standard documentation includes: H.D. Bolts, Purlin/Girt schedules, Material & Bolt lists, Drawing Register, Detailed structural steel component drawings, plate, NC cutting data, 3D DWF model and cleat cutting lists.

Name: ingenhoven architects

Overview: ingenhoven architects is an architecture and planning company based in Düsseldorf, Germany. The office is internationally recognized for sustainable architecture and has won numerous first prizes in international competitions and architectural awards.In fact Ingenhoven Architects is known to be a pioneer in the field of sustainable architecture for three decades. Since 1985, when Christoph Ingenhoven has founded the office, the architects, designers and planners of Ingenhoven Architects have realized projects of almost every type and size and in almost all regions of the world. Name: The Doyenne Interviews
Location: Melbourne , 3000 3000, AU
Overview: The Doyenne Interviews The Doyenne Interviews is a podcast by Bridget Nathan that features exceptional women working in architecture and design. Launched in 2019 through Parlour, the interviews are a resource and a reflection on what it means to be part of this industry. The project has chosen to interview women only at this point because I feel that our voices are often a little quieter than others and I would like to contribute to celebrating the talent that’s around us. Topics discussed aren’t just ‘women’s issues’, but include family life, mental health and advocacy within our profession: issues that affect us all. ​Despite their immense success, these women were generous enough to share their vulnerabilities and provide insights into what motivates them in both their careers and personal lives. I hope you enjoy listening to the episodes, I look forward to continuing the project. ​Season One can currently be found on Soundcloud

Overview: Fabric Architecture is a contemporary design studio located on the Central Coast of New South Wales, Australia. We focus on Architecture and design - from buildings to public space, to small scale bespoke furniture design.Fabric was founded on the belief that Architecture, no matter how large or small, is not a matter of style or trend but an ability to create social interaction and help shape an individuals experience in this world, both in the larger context right down to one’s tactile experience in their immediate surrounding environment. It is throughout this experience that perceptions are altered, building types are re-imagined and new ways of experiencing architecture realised.We work inclusively with our clients: to work up an open brief, to imagine all possibilities, to open dialogue for collaborative problem solving and to discover methods for providing intentioned yet specific design solutions to real needs.  We feel the most successful projects have both an openness and specificity, so that change may occur but the fundamental ideas remain intact.  We seek to create buildings that make intuitive sense at every scale, from the holistic notions of site planning, down to the tangible experience of the touch of a material.Our approach to Architecture in a constantly changing digital age is all inclusive; with social, practical, economical and environmental issues integrated within the design process. We consider Architecture to be a process of dialogue and we involve selected experts and consultants, across multiple disciplines, in every stage of the design process.Nominated Architect - Damien Furey #10769

Name: XO Projects

XO Projects is the result of two offices – Elenberg Fraser, Melbourne and Elastik, Amsterdam – combining forces to realise a practice with sustained commercial and design research credentials. Founded in 2016, XO Projects is a studio with legacy and momentum, with active large projects in Central / South East Asia, Europe and America.

XO Projects’ working method is synchronized with our clients’ imperatives. A studio that straddles research and a client focused culture based within the beating heart of the world’s most dynamic urbanities. Our process is focused on helping cities to compete in the ‘experience economy’, which requires environments to stand out.

We create the Extra Ordinaries within cities. XO achieves this by combining craftsmanship, what is incremental in life, with the technologies that transform industry and human relations. A fusion that ensures places are homely and desirable; a built environment that talks to local traditions and to the current marketplace of ideas.

We are skilled at curating the local into the new, ensuring distinctiveness and warding off industrial sameness. We design products and solutions that empower our customers and enable cities to grow humanely.

Name: The Greenwall Company
Location: PO Box 464, Newport Beach, NSW 2106, AU
Overview:
The Greenwall Company is the premier producer of custom designed greenwalls and green roofs in Australia. 
 
The Greenwall Company vision is to reclaim the built environment by clothing the facades of buildings with epiphytic and lithophytic planting to create a living, breathing architectural function to every building. 
 
We are 100% Australian owned and operated. Our greenwall panels and ecopillows are made from 94% recycled materials, that would otherwise be destined for Australian landfill. Soil-less and bespoke in design, our greenwalls are designed to live the lifetime of the building.
 
Over the past 25 years Mark Paul, founder of The Greenwall Company, has fine tuned the design and technology behind the installations we produce. Not only are the company multi-award winners but Mark's first greenwall, built over 25 years ago, is still flourishing today.
 
Working with architects, landscape architects, designers and builders, The Greenwall Company uses award winning design techniques, passion and expertise in horticulture across residential and commercial projects, to bring greenwalls to a new level of integration within the built environment. This successful formula has expanded both interstate and internationally with a number of partners sharing both our vision and patented technology. The Greenwall Company's projects can be seen from Australia and New Zealand to Singapore and Brasil.
 
We are also involved in a school community project called The PET Bottle Greenwall Project, where we educate students on the benefits beyond the beauty of greenwalls and the importance of sustainability. 
 
Recent Award Wins:
Melbourne Design Awards 2012
Sydney Design Award 2012
Finalist World Environment Day Awards 2013
Finalist Sydney Design Award 2014 
Finalist in BPN Sustainablity Awards 2014

Name: CA Architects
Location: null
Overview:
CA Architects has been practicing in Cairns for over 20 years and is recognized in its own right as one of the region’s leading design practices. Our designs reflect the knowledge and understanding we have of the environment and lifestyle of the far North. CA’s work extends through office, institutional and commercial architecture with a focus on Ecologically Sustainable Development (ESD).

The principal areas where CA Architects will add significant value to the project are:
• 	Local knowledge & experience with projects in tropical regions
• 	Understanding of urban planning principles
• 	Proven track record in providing quality design to government and commercial clients
• 	A culture of personal service tailored to each commission ensuring a smooth and efficient design and approval process
• 	Expertise in specific requirements such as accessibility and low maintenance solutions in regional tropical locations

It is of value in our view that we have proven our ESD design and analytical methodology on the 9000 m2 NLA William McCormack
Place project in Cairns as well as the McClintock residence, a small one bedroom residence outside Kuranda, and can thus directly translate this tropic region refined ability to the Rainforest Observatory Project.

We continually demonstrate that good design, sustainable buildings and affordability are not mutually exclusive.


Technologies & Capabilities
Our capabilities include:
• 	Master planning
• 	Project management
• 	Concept design
• 	Documentation
• 	Contract administration
• 	ESD/Green Star submissions

URBANISM - PLANNING AND DEVELOPING LIVING COMMUNITIES

Urbanism was established by Corey Verwey in 2011 to combine the diligence of Project Management with Urban Design. Name: UDLA
Location: Level 1A, 3-5 Josephson Street, Fremantle, Western Australia 6160, AU
Overview:
UDLA is a multi-award winning studio specialising in Landscape Architecture, Urban Design, & Community Development. We believe that Landscape Architecture, the creation of places that inspire interest, interaction and sociality, is not a simple one-off enterprise. To us, it is the result of an inclusive process that involves all of the people it seeks to engage in equal measure, whether they are end users, contributing professional participants, or stakeholders.  It is a progression through history, environment, population and practice, encompassing commercial, social, behavioural and aesthetic goals.

This approach hinges on the understanding that people and place need to be connected. Therefore the health of a community has an intrinsic relationship with how empowered participants are engaged with their environment, or have a say in changing their existing condition into a preferred one. This ‘people first’ approach makes UDLA unique amongst design studios in WA and a leader in contemporary design thinking.

Our work begins by listening in order to identify the requirements and uniqueness of the multiple user groups likely to inhabit a place, and envisioning a spatial outcome that works for all of them by collaborating, sharing ideas and generating collective creativity. Our role goes beyond that of traditional landscape architects; we see ourselves as facilitators, designers, coordinators, communicators and, at times, mentors. Our inclusive approach, and the agreement that stems from it, allows us to proceed with the detailed design work – the documentation and realisation of all those ideas – with confidence and originality.

Our task is to create successful public spaces; our process ensures that we do.

We are committed to delivering socially, environmentally and economically sustainable architecture, that is a product of its context and client ambitions. Our projects are elegantly conceived, delightful to use and detailed with technical refinement. The process aims to reveal the unique opportunities within each project to realise its maximum potential.Every project starts with an open mindset and an exploration of our client’s priorities and ambitions. This is then layered with a broader site and contextual investigation along with consultant, stakeholder, and budget considerations for the creation of a unique piece of architecture. This dialogue and enquiry aims to test and challenge the existing narrative to identify shortcomings and drive innovation, to deliver creative spaces for living that are finely tailored to the needs of the people who will use it. The Fuse team draws on expertise forged in some of Australia’s leading architectural and urban design practices. Name: HSPC Health Architects

Overview:
HSPC Health Architects comprises of a large group of very talented and results driven architects, designers and health planners. Since our establishment in 1990, the company has grown into one of Australia’s leading design practices in the health care and aged care sectors. 

Our team of highly skilled clinical, technical and health planners bring their own individual expertise and professional focus to each project, in the areas of design development, clinical, technical and health facility planning, feasibility studies, detailed design and documentation. 

One of the advantages of working with us is that we have the ability to provide to our clients’ end-to-end, tailored solutions that are seamless in the delivery from the creative concept stage right through to completion. It’s our promise to our clients that the projects we undertake are delivered on time and in budget.

As specialist health architects, we pride ourselves on our ongoing commitment to the extensive research and development that the health care and aged care industry requires, which enables us to maintain a current approach and cutting edge in our designs. 

Our philosophy is built on the belief that our designs must start with people first. The varying needs of the people who will ultimately inhabit our buildings are at the forefront of our minds throughout the entire design process. This strategy has enabled us to create award-winning healthcare designs that are functional but also beautifully articulated; and on an internal level are equally practical, as they are aesthetically appealing.

Our company is also part of the Melbourne based Peddle Thorp Group – one of Australia’s largest design services businesses. The Group offers a comprehensive consultancy that also includes Peddle Thorp Architects (PTA), Peddle Thorp Interior Design (PTID) and Sustainable Built Environments (SBE), a specialist ESD firm. With the ability to draw on over 150 staff, no project is too large or complex.

Name: International Academy for Design and Health
Location: Junction Rd, Clayfield, Queensland 4011, AU
Overview: Our vision is to foster Salutogenic design to promote health and wellbeing by creating physical environments that support health promotion and thereby healthy societies.The International Academy for Design & Health (IADH) is a global non-profit organisation with an interdisciplinary knowledge community dedicated to the stimulation and application of research concerning the interaction between design, health, science, culture and economics.Founded by Dr Alan Dilani at the Karolinska Institute, Medical University in Stockholm in 1997 after the successful outcome of the 1st World Congress in Trondheim in Norway, the aim of the IADH is to provide a highly visible global forum for promoting an ongoing international exchange of research findings among scientists, designers, health professionals, industry and Ministries of Health worldwide.Faced with the 21st century challenges of chronic disease, ageing populations and rising healthcare costs, global health systems are seeking new ways to address these growing threats to the development of a healthy and productive global society.

They measure the quality of 'place experience'​ and captures community insights - considering the physical, economic, social and cultural attributes that contribute to people valuing and wanting to spend time in a place.  Place Score offers essential planning tools and data for councils, developers and urban planners or designers who are interested in community led design to ensure that urban renewal and investment decisions are embraced and supported by the communities who will use them.
